page.title: 07JOBS IN LAUGHARNE
page.content: Dairy/stock farming, all self- employed, some part-time and semi- retired, 2 acting as agricultural con- tractors, 2 full-time fishermen, 17 self-employed shops. Seasonal potato- picking for 18 people. 4 restaurants 2 caravan sites employ seasonal staff, 6 publicans, 2 cafes and one fish & chip shop employ mostly family and some part-timers. 5 houses do bed and breakfast. Small businesses include builders, engineers, fabric-printers and pottery. A few teachers, nurses, policemen, doctors, council clerks and labourers. Coygan Quarry (1 mile) employs 12 local men and women, with wages from Â£70-Â£92 pw for 40 hours. The MOD Establishment (3 miles) employs 42 men 3 women from Laugharne, including 3 clerks, 4 skilled and 33 semi-skilled industrial workers. Wages from Â£98-Â£132 pw gross.
